author: Anonymous Beaker
title: PSet 10 check expect?
question:
In problem 5, why is the result of check-expect (max-credit-path C110) (list 110 210 310 319))? 
I made a tree from pset 6 of C110, and from that tree, I would expect that the result of C110 should be (list 110 210 213 221 310 319), as all of these courses have the max number of four credits. 
I know that the extra courses I mentioned (213 221) are not direct subs of C110, but of 210, but so is 310, so I'm not understanding why it isn't included? Or am I just understanding the problem wrong? 
pset_10_problem_5_graphic
student_answer: I had a hard time wrapping my head around this too. What you're producing is the path of courses that starts from C110 and ends at a course without any dependents that contain the maximum amount of total credits - as in, more credits than any other path. (list 110 210 310 319) is the produced answer because taking that path leads to the most amount of total credits - 16.
